item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7839)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S7838-7839)

summary.text:
Stay-At-Home Parents' Tax Credit Act of 2003 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide within the dependent care credit a minimum credit of $200 per month for stay-at-home parents with one or more qualifying individuals under the age of six at any time during the year.

Allows: (1) the dependent care credit to be taken against the minimum tax; and (2) a carryforward of any unused dependent care credit.

bill.title: Stay-At-Home Parents' Tax Credit Act of 2003

item.title: Stay-At-Home Parents' Tax Credit Act of 2003

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a minimum credit of $200 per month for stay-at-home parents, to allow the dependent care credit to be taken against the minimum tax, and to allow a carryforward of any unused dependent care credit.
Stay-At-Home Parents' Tax Credit Act of 2003

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S7839)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
